article.title: Modeling the Spectral Energy Distribution of the radio galaxy IC310

choices: The SED of IC310 described with a single-zone SSC model.
The SED of IC310 described with a multi-zone SSC model with two electron populations.
The neutrino flux from IC310 based on a hadronic model.
The UHECR spectrum of IC310 compared to other radio galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 2, what is the primary mechanism responsible for the TeV - GeV gamma-ray emission in IC310?
choices: Synchrotron radiation from electrons.
Inverse Compton scattering of synchrotron photons by electrons.
Neutral pion decay products resulting from proton-photon interactions.
Curvature radiation from electrons in the jet.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 3 illustrate about the relationship between IC310 and observed UHECRs and neutrinos?
choices: IC310 is a confirmed source of both UHECRs and neutrinos.
There is a strong correlation between the location of IC310 and observed UHECRs.
There is no clear association between IC310 and observed UHECRs or neutrino events.
The neutrino events observed by IceCube are clustered around the position of IC310.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Table 1, what is a key difference between the two electron populations in the multi-zone SSC model?
choices: The magnetic field strength in their respective emitting regions.
The minimum Lorentz factor of the electrons.
The spectral index of the electron energy distribution.
The size of their respective emitting regions.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the lepton-hadronic model presented in Table 2, what is the estimated proton luminosity (Lp) for IC310 during the high state?
choices: 24.1 erg/s
